column5: and itâ€™s unbelievably ignorant. thereâ€™s sort of this interesting circular form to dealing with mental illness
column6: where you start in a place ofÂ â€œi just need to think positively and push myself out of this ditchâ€ and then you move to step 2
column7: which isÂ â€œdepression is a real and very serious illness and itâ€™s not my fault that iâ€™m tired all the time
column8: stop telling me to justÂ â€œthink positiveâ€ all the time.â€ But then thereâ€™s step three
column9: which is where you size up your situation and sayÂ â€œlook
column10: i understand how serious my illness is
column11: and iâ€™m no longer blaming myself for it. Â And it sucks
column13: and I didnâ€™t bring it on myself. Â But regardless of how unfair it is
column14: the truth is that Iâ€™m the only one who can actually do anything about it.â€ Â And so in a lot of ways
column15: you end up with parallel ways of thinking as before
column16: but this time youâ€™re coming from a completely different source of understanding. Â People who donâ€™t know anything about mental illness sayÂ â€œdepression is a choice.â€ Â People who are fed up with being depressed and realize that wallowing in the comforting embrace of self-pity is useful to erase guilt
column17: but ultimately wonâ€™t help them lead a better life say
column18: Â â€œrecovery is a choice.â€ The first group means that if youâ€™re depressed
column19: you can just magically decide not to be depressed. Â The second group means that depression is a crushing weight on your back determined to make your life as miserable (and as short) as possible
column20: and that you didnâ€™t do anything to cause it

column24: and with the good intention of creating communities of understanding and non-judgement between mentally ill people

Â And thatâ€™s how itâ€™s gotten to the point of people dismissing actual mental health professionals as being no different than some ignorant person who doesnâ€™t know the first thing about psychology and thinks an avocado smoothie will solve all your problems. column32: haha look at this funny meme about how much you want to kill yourself.â€ Â Your therapist is going to give you recommendations of activities and habits that will help you recover.
